Description: The NIST 800-53 (Rev. 5) Low-Moderate-High framework represents the security controls and the associated assessment procedures that are defined in NIST SP 800-53 Revision 5 Recommended Security Controls for Federal Information Systems and Organizations. For any discrepancies that are noted in the content between this NIST SP 800-53 framework and the latest published NIST Special Publication SP 800-53 Revision 5, refer to the official published documents that are available at the NIST Computer Security Resource Center.

Requirements.Name: AC-2(1) Automated System Account Management
Requirements.Description: Support the management of system accounts using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

Requirements.Name: AC-2(3)(a)
Requirements.Description: Support the management of system accounts using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

Requirements.Name: AC-2(3)(b)
Requirements.Description: Disable accounts within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] when the accounts: (b) Are no longer associated with a user or individual.

Requirements.Name: AC-2(3)(c)
Requirements.Description: Disable accounts within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] when the accounts: (c) Are in violation of organizational policy.

Requirements.Name: AC-2(3)(d)
Requirements.Description: Disable accounts within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] when the accounts: (d) Have been inactive for [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

Requirements.Name: AC-2(3) Disable Accounts
Requirements.Description: Disable accounts within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] when the accounts: (a) Have expired; (b) Are no longer associated with a user or individual; (c) Are in violation of organizational policy; or (d) Have been inactive for [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

Requirements.Name: AC-2(4) Automated Audit Actions
Requirements.Description: Automatically audit account creation, modification, enabling, disabling, and removal actions.

Requirements.Name: AC-2(6) Dynamic Privilege Management
Requirements.Description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined dynamic privilege management capabilities].

Requirements.Name: AC-2(12)(a)
Requirements.Description: Monitor system accounts for [Assignment: organization-defined atypical usage].

Requirements.Name: AC-2(d)(1)
Requirements.Description: d. Specify: 1. Authorized users of the system;personnel termination and transfer processes.

Requirements.Name: AC-2(g)
Requirements.Description: The organization: g. Monitors the use of information system accounts.

Requirements.Name: AC-2(i)(2)
Requirements.Description: i. Authorize access to the system based on: 2. Intended system usage.

Requirements.Name: AC-2(j)
Requirements.Description: The organization: j. Reviews accounts for compliance with account management requirements [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

Requirements.Name: Access Enforcement (AC-3)
Requirements.Description: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(1) Restricted Access To Privileged Functions
Requirements.Description: Employ an audited override of automated access control mechanisms under [Assignment: organization-defined conditions] by [Assignment: organization-defined roles].

Requirements.Name: AC-3(2) Dual Authorization
Requirements.Description: Enforce dual authorization for [Assignment: organization-defined privileged commands and/or other organization-defined actions].

Requirements.Name: AC-3(3) Mandatory Access Control
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access control policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (a) Is uniformly enforced across the covered subjects and objects within the system; (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (1) Passing the information to unauthorized subjects or objects; (2) Granting its privileges to other subjects; (3) Changing one or more security attributes (specified by the policy) on subjects, objects, the system, or system components; (4) Choosing the security attributes and attribute values (specified by the policy) to be associated with newly created or modified objects; and (5) Changing the rules governing access control; and (c) Specifies that [Assignment: organization-defined subjects] may explicitly be granted [Assignment: organization-defined privileges] such that they are not limited by any defined subset (or all) of the above constraints.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(3)(a)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (a) Is uniformly enforced across the covered subjects and objects within the system.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(3)(b)(1)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (1) Passing the information to unauthorized subjects or objects.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(3)(b)(2)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (2) Granting its privileges to other subjects.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(3)(b)(3)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (3) Changing one or more security attributes (specified by the policy) on subjects, objects, the system, or system components.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(3)(b)(4)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (4) Choosing the security attributes and attribute values (specified by the policy) to be associated with newly created or modified objects.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(3)(b)(5)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (5) Changing the rules governing access.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(3)(c)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (c) Specifies that [Assignment: organization-defined subjects] may explicitly be granted [Assignment: organization-defined privileges] such that they are not limited by any defined subset (or all) of the above constraints.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(4) Discretionary Access Control
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access control policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (a) Pass the information to any other subjects or objects; (b) Grant its privileges to other subjects; (c) Change security attributes on subjects, objects, the system, or the system’s components; (d) Choose the security attributes to be associated with newly created or revised objects; or (e) Change the rules governing access control.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(4)(a)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (a) Pass the information to any other subjects or objects.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(4)(b)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (b) Grant its privileges to other subjects.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(4)(c)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (c) Change security attributes on subjects, objects, the system, or the system’s components.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(4)(d)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (d) Choose the security attributes to be associated with newly created or revised objects.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(4)(e)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (e) Change the rules governing access.

Requirements.Name: AC-3(7) Role-Based Access Control
Requirements.Description: Enforce a role-based access control policy over defined subjects and objects and control access based upon [Assignment: organization-defined roles and users authorized to assume such roles].

Requirements.Name: AC-3(8) Revocation Of Access Authorizations
Requirements.Description: Enforce the revocation of access authorizations resulting from changes to the security attributes of subjects and objects based on [Assignment: organization-defined rules governing the timing of revocations of access authorizations].

Requirements.Name: AC-3(10) Audited Override Of Access Control Mechanisms
Requirements.Description: Employ an audited override of automated access mechanisms under [Assignment: organization-defined conditions] by [Assignment: organization-defined roles].

Requirements.Name: AC-3(12)(a)
Requirements.Description: Require applications to assert, as part of the installation process, the access needed to the following system applications and functions: [Assignment: organization-defined system applications and functions].

Attributes.SubGroup: AC-3(12)  Assert And Enforce Application Access

Requirements.Name: AC-3(12)(b)
Requirements.Description: Provide an enforcement mechanism to prevent unauthorized access;

Attributes.SubGroup: AC-3(12) Assert And Enforce Application Access

Requirements.Name: AC-3(13) Attribute-Based Access Control
Requirements.Description: Enforce attribute-based access control policy over defined subjects and objects and control access based upon [Assignment: organization-defined attributes to assume access permissions].

Requirements.Name: AC-3(15)(a)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access control policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy.

Attributes.SubGroup: AC-3(15) Discretionary And Mandatory Access Control

Requirements.Name: AC-3(15)(b)
Requirements.Description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access control policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy.

Attributes.SubGroup: AC-3(15) Discretionary And Mandatory Access Control

Requirements.Name: Information Flow Enforcement (AC-4)
Requirements.Description: Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between connected systems based on [Assignment: organization-defined information flow control policies].

Requirements.Name: AC-4(21) Physical Or Logical Separation Of Infomation Flows
Requirements.Description: Separate information flows logically or physically using [Assignment: organization-defined mechanisms and/or techniques] to accomplish [Assignment: organization-defined required separations by types of information].

Requirements.Name: AC-4(22) Access Only
Requirements.Description: Provide access from a single device to computing platforms, applications, or data residing in multiple different security domains, while preventing information flow between the different security domains.

Requirements.Name: AC-4(26) Audit Filtering Actions
Requirements.Description: When transferring information between different security domains, record and audit content filtering actions and results for the information being filtered.

Requirements.Name: AC-4(28) Linear Filter Pipelines
Requirements.Description: When transferring information between different security domains, implement a linear content filter pipeline that is enforced with discretionary and mandatory access controls.

Requirements.Name: AC-5(b)
Requirements.Description: Define system access authorizations to support separation of duties.

Requirements.Name: Least Privilege (AC-6)
Requirements.Description: Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses for users (or processes acting on behalf of users) that are necessary to accomplish assigned organizational tasks.

Requirements.Name: AC-6(2)
Requirements.Description: Require that users of system accounts (or roles) with access to [Assignment: organization-defined security functions or security-relevant information] use non-privileged accounts or roles, when accessing nonsecurity functions.

Requirements.Name: AC-6(3)
Requirements.Description: Authorize network access to [Assignment: organization-defined privileged commands] only for [Assignment: organization-defined compelling operational needs] and document the rationale for such access in the security plan for the system.

Requirements.Name: AC-6(9)
Requirements.Description: Log the execution of privileged functions.

Requirements.Name: AC-6(10)
Requirements.Description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

Requirements.Name: AC-7(4) Use Of Alternate Authentication Factor
Requirements.Description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

Requirements.Name: AC-7(4)(a)
Requirements.Description: Allow the use of [Assignment: organization-defined authentication factors] that are different from the primary authentication factors after the number of organization-defined consecutive invalid logon attempts have been exceeded.

Attributes.SubGroup: AC-7(4) Use Of Alternate Authentication Factor

Requirements.Name: AC-16(b)
Requirements.Description: Ensure that the attribute associations are made and retained with the information.

Requirements.Name: AC-17(b)
Requirements.Description: Authorize each type of remote access to the system prior to allowing such connections.

Requirements.Name: AC-17(1) Monitoring And Control
Requirements.Description: Employ automated mechanisms to monitor and control remote access methods.

Requirements.Name: AC-17(2) Protection Of Confidentiality And Integrity Using Encryption
Requirements.Description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions.

Requirements.Name: AC-17(4)(a)
Requirements.Description: Authorize the execution of privileged commands and access to security-relevant information via remote access only in a format that provides assessable evidence and for the following needs: [Assignment: organization-defined needs];

Requirements.Name: AC-17(9) Disconnect Or Disable Access
Requirements.Description: Provide the capability to disconnect or disable remote access to the system within [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

Requirements.Name: AC-17(10) Authenticate Remote Commands
Requirements.Description: Provide the capability to disconnect or disable remote access to the system within [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

Requirements.Name: Access Control Decisions (AC-24)
Requirements.Description: [Selection: Establish procedures; Implement mechanisms] to ensure [Assignment: organization-defined access control decisions] are applied to each access request prior to access enforcement.

Requirements.Name: AC-24(1)
Requirements.Description: Transmit [Assignment: organization-defined access authorization information] using [Assignment: organization-defined controls] to [Assignment: organization-defined systems] that enforce access control decisions.

Requirements.Name: AU-2(b)
Requirements.Description: Coordinate the event logging function with other organizational entities requiring audit-related information to guide and inform the selection criteria for events to be logged.

Requirements.Name: AU-3(1) Additional Audit Information
Requirements.Description: Generate audit records containing the following additional information: [Assignment: organization-defined additional information].

Requirements.Name: AU-3(a)
Requirements.Description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: a. What type of event occurred.

Requirements.Name: AU-3(b)
Requirements.Description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: b. When the event occurred.

Requirements.Name: AU-3(c)
Requirements.Description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: c. Where the event occurred.

Requirements.Name: AU-3(d)
Requirements.Description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: d. Source of the event.

Requirements.Name: AU-3(e)
Requirements.Description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: e. Outcome of the event.

Requirements.Name: AU-3(f)
Requirements.Description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: e. Outcome of the event.

Requirements.Name: AU-4(1) Transfer To Alternate Storage
Requirements.Description: Transfer audit logs [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] to a different system, system component, or media other than the system or system component conducting the logging.

Requirements.Name: AU-6(1) Automated Process Integration
Requirements.Description: Integrate audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

Attributes.SubSection: Audit Record Review, Analysis And Reporting (AU-6)

Requirements.Name: AU-6(3) Correlate Audit Record Repositories
Requirements.Description: Analyze and correlate audit records across different repositories to gain organization-wide situational awareness.

Attributes.SubSection: Audit Record Review, Analysis And Reporting (AU-6)

Requirements.Name: AU-6(4) Central Review And Analysis
Requirements.Description: Provide and implement the capability to centrally review and analyze audit records from multiple components within the system.

Attributes.SubSection: Audit Record Review, Analysis And Reporting (AU-6)

Requirements.Name: AU-6(5) Central Review And Analysis
Requirements.Description: Integrate analysis of audit records with analysis of [Selection (one or more): vulnerability scanning information; performance data; system monitoring information; [Assignment: organization-defined data/information collected from other sources]] to further enhance the ability to identify inappropriate or unusual activity.

Attributes.SubSection: Audit Record Review, Analysis And Reporting (AU-6)

Requirements.Name: AU-6(6) Correletion With Physical Monitoring
Requirements.Description: Correlate information from audit records with information obtained from monitoring physical access to further enhance the ability to identify suspicious, inappropriate, unusual, or malevolent activity.

Attributes.SubSection: Audit Record Review, Analysis And Reporting (AU-6)

Requirements.Name: AU-6(9) Correletion With From Nontechnical Sources
Requirements.Description: Correlate information from nontechnical sources with audit record information to enhance organization-wide situational awareness.

Attributes.SubSection: Audit Record Review, Analysis And Reporting (AU-6)

Requirements.Name: AU-7(1) Automatic Processing
Requirements.Description: Provide and implement the capability to process, sort, and search audit records for events of interest based on the following content: [Assignment: organization-defined fields within audit records].

Attributes.SubSection: Audit Record Reduction And Report Generation (AU-7)

Requirements.Name: AU-8(b)
Requirements.Description: Record time stamps for audit records that meet [Assignment: organization-defined granularity of time measurement] and that use Coordinated Universal Time, have a fixed local time offset from Coordinated Universal Time, or that include the local time offset as part of the time stamp.

Requirements.Name: AU-9(a)
Requirements.Description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

Requirements.Name: AU-9(2) Store On Separate Physical Systems Or Components
Requirements.Description: Store audit records [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] in a repository that is part of a physically different system or system component than the system or component being audited.

Requirements.Name: AU-9(3) Cryptographic Protection
Requirements.Description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the integrity of audit information and audit tools.

Requirements.Name: AU-9(7) Store On Component With Different Operation Systems
Requirements.Description: Store audit information on a component running a different operating system than the system or component being audited.

Requirements.Name: Non-Repudiation (AU-10)
Requirements.Description: Provide irrefutable evidence that an individual (or process acting on behalf of an individual) has performed [Assignment: organization-defined actions to be covered by non-repudiation].

Requirements.Name: Audit Record Retention (AU-11)
Requirements.Description: Retain audit records for [Assignment: organization-defined time period consistent with records retention policy] to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of incidents and to meet regulatory and organizational information retention requirements.

Requirements.Name: AU-11(1) Long-Term Retrieval Capability
Requirements.Description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined measures] to ensure that long-term audit records generated by the system can be retrieved.

Requirements.Name: AU-12(a)
Requirements.Description: Provide audit record generation capability for the event types the system is capable of auditing as defined in AU-2a on [Assignment: organization-defined system components].

Requirements.Name: AU-12(c)
Requirements.Description: Generate audit records for the event types defined in AU-2c that include the audit record content defined in AU-3.

Requirements.Name: AU-12(1) System-Wide And Time-Correlated Audit Trial
Requirements.Description: Compile audit records from [Assignment: organization-defined system components] into a system-wide (logical or physical) audit trail that is time-correlated to within [Assignment: organization-defined level of tolerance for the relationship between time stamps of individual records in the audit trail].

Requirements.Name: AU-12(2) Standardized Formats
Requirements.Description: Produce a system-wide (logical or physical) audit trail composed of audit records in a standardized format.

Requirements.Name: AU-12(3) Changes By Authorized Individuals
Requirements.Description: Provide and implement the capability for [Assignment: organization-defined individuals or roles] to change the logging to be performed on [Assignment: organization-defined system components] based on [Assignment: organization-defined selectable event criteria] within [Assignment: organization-defined time thresholds].

Requirements.Name: AU-12(4) Query Parameter Audits Of Personally Identifiable Information
Requirements.Description: Provide and implement the capability for auditing the parameters of user query events for data sets containing personally identifiable information.

Requirements.Name: AU-14(a)
Requirements.Description: Provide and implement the capability for [Assignment: organization-defined users or roles] to [Selection (one or more): record; view; hear; log] the content of a user session under [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances].

Requirements.Name: AU-14(b)
Requirements.Description: Develop, integrate, and use session auditing activities in consultation with legal counsel and in accordance with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines.

Requirements.Name: AU-14(3) Remote Viewing And Listening
Requirements.Description: Provide and implement the capability for authorized users to remotely view and hear content related to an established user session in real time.

Requirements.Name: Cross-Organizational Audit Logging (AU-16)
Requirements.Description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined methods] for coordinating [Assignment: organization-defined audit information] among external organizations when audit information is transmitted across organizational boundaries.

Requirements.Name: CA-2(2) Specialized Assessments
Requirements.Description: Include as part of control assessments, [Assignment: organization-defined frequency], [Selection: announced; unannounced], [Selection (one or more): in-depth monitoring; security instrumentation; automated security test cases; vulnerability scanning; malicious user testing; insider threat assessment; performance and load testing; data leakage or data loss assessment; [Assignment: organization-defined other forms of assessment]].

Requirements.Name: CA-2(d)
Requirements.Description: Assess the controls in the system and its environment of operation [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting established security and privacy requirements.

Requirements.Name: Continuous Monitoring (CA-7)
Requirements.Description: Continuously monitor configuration management processes. Determine security impact, environment and operational risks.

Requirements.Name: CA-7(b)
Requirements.Description: Develop a system-level continuous monitoring strategy and implement continuous monitoring in accordance with the organization-level continuous monitoring strategy that includes: b. Establishing [Assignment: organization-defined frequencies] for monitoring and [Assignment: organization-defined frequencies] for assessment of control effectiveness.

Requirements.Name: CA-7(4)(c)
Requirements.Description: Ensure risk monitoring is an integral part of the continuous monitoring strategy that includes the following: (c) Change monitoring.

Requirements.Name: CA-9(b)
Requirements.Description: Document, for each internal connection, the interface characteristics, security and privacy requirements, and the nature of the information communicated.

Requirements.Name: CM-2(a)
Requirements.Description: Develop, document, and maintain under configuration control, a current baseline configuration of the system.

Requirements.Name: CM-2(b)
Requirements.Description: Review and update the baseline configuration of the system: 1. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]; 2. When required due to [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances]; and 3. When system components are installed or upgraded.

Requirements.Name: CM-2(b)(1)
Requirements.Description: Review and update the baseline configuration of the system: 1. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

Requirements.Name: CM-2(b)(2)
Requirements.Description: Review and update the baseline configuration of the system: 2. When required due to [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances].

Requirements.Name: CM-2(b)(3)
Requirements.Description: Review and update the baseline configuration of the system: 3 When system components are installed or upgraded.

Requirements.Name: CM-2(2) Automation Support For Accuracy And Currency
Requirements.Description: Maintain the currency, completeness, accuracy, and availability of the baseline configuration of the system using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

Requirements.Name: CM-3(3) Automated Change Implementation
Requirements.Description: Implement changes to the current system baseline and deploy the updated baseline across the installed base using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

Requirements.Name: CM-3(a)
Requirements.Description: Determine and document the types of changes to the system that are configuration-controlled.

Requirements.Name: CM-5(1)(a)
Requirements.Description: Enforce access restrictions using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

Attributes.SubGroup: CM-5(1) Automated Access Enforcement And Audit Records

Requirements.Name: CM-5(1)(b)
Requirements.Description: Automatically generate audit records of the enforcement actions.

Attributes.SubGroup: CM-5(1) Automated Access Enforcement And Audit Records

Requirements.Name: Configuration Settings (CM-6)
Requirements.Description: The organization: (i) establishes mandatory configuration settings for information technology products employed within the information system; (ii) configures the security settings of information technology products to the most restrictive mode consistent with operational requirements; (iii) documents the configuration settings; and (iv) enforces the configuration settings in all components of the information system.

Requirements.Name: CM-6(a)
Requirements.Description: Establish and document configuration settings for components employed within the system that reflect the most restrictive mode consistent with operational requirements using [Assignment: organization-defined common secure configurations].

Requirements.Name: CM-7(b)
Requirements.Description: Prohibit or restrict the use of the following functions, ports, protocols, software, and/or services: [Assignment: organization-defined prohibited or restricted functions, system ports, protocols, software, and/or services].

Requirements.Name: CM-8(1) Updates During Installation And Removals
Requirements.Description: Update the inventory of system components as part of component installations, removals, and system updates.

Requirements.Name: CM-8(2) Automated Maintenance
Requirements.Description: Maintain the currency, completeness, accuracy, and availability of the inventory of system components using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

Requirements.Name: CM-8(3)(a)
Requirements.Description: Detect the presence of unauthorized hardware, software, and firmware components within the system using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms] [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

Requirements.Name: CM-8(6) Assessed Configurations And Approved Deviations
Requirements.Description: Include assessed component configurations and any approved deviations to current deployed configurations in the system component inventory.

Requirements.Name: CM-8(a)
Requirements.Description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 1. Accurately reflects the system; 2. Includes all components within the system; 3. Does not include duplicate accounting of components or components assigned to any other system; 4. Is at the level of granularity deemed necessary for tracking and reporting; and 5. Includes the following information to achieve system component accountability: [Assignment: organization-defined information deemed necessary to achieve effective system component accountability].

Requirements.Name: CM-8(a)(1)
Requirements.Description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 1. Accurately reflects the system.

Requirements.Name: CM-8(a)(2)
Requirements.Description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 2. Includes all components within the system.

Requirements.Name: CM-8(a)(3)
Requirements.Description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 3. Does not include duplicate accounting of components or components assigned to any other system.

Requirements.Name: CM-8(a)(4)
Requirements.Description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 4. Is at the level of granularity deemed necessary for tracking and reporting.

Requirements.Name: CM-8(a)(5)
Requirements.Description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 5. Includes the following information to achieve system component accountability: [Assignment: organization-defined information deemed necessary to achieve effective system component accountability].

Requirements.Name: CM-8(b)
Requirements.Description: Review and update the system component inventory [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

Requirements.Name: CM-9(b)
Requirements.Description: Develop, document, and implement a configuration management plan for the system that: b. Establishes a process for identifying configuration items throughout the system development life cycle and for managing the configuration of the configuration items.

Requirements.Name: CM-12(b)
Requirements.Description: Identify and document the users who have access to the system and system components where the information is processed and stored.

Requirements.Name: CP-1(a)(1)(b)
Requirements.Description: a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]: 1. [Selection (one or more): Organization-level; Mission/business process-level; System-level] contingency planning policy that: (b) Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines.

Requirements.Name: CP-1(a)(2)
Requirements.Description: a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]: 2. Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the contingency planning policy and the associated contingency planning controls.

Requirements.Name: CP-1(2)
Requirements.Description: Implement transaction recovery for systems that are transaction-based.

Requirements.Name: CP-2(a)
Requirements.Description: a. Develop a contingency plan for the system that: 1. Identifies essential mission and business functions and associated contingency requirements; 2. Provides recovery objectives, restoration priorities, and metrics; 3. Addresses contingency roles, responsibilities, assigned individuals with contact information; 4. Addresses maintaining essential mission and business functions despite a system disruption, compromise, or failure; 5. Addresses eventual, full system restoration without deterioration of the controls originally planned and implemented; 6. Addresses the sharing of contingency information; and 7. Is reviewed and approved by [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]

Requirements.Name: CP-2(a)(6)
Requirements.Description: Develop a contingency plan for the system that: 6. Addresses the sharing of contingency information.

Requirements.Name: CP-2(a)(7)
Requirements.Description: Develop a contingency plan for the system that: 7. Is reviewed and approved by [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles].

Requirements.Name: CP-2(d)
Requirements.Description: Review the contingency plan for the system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]

Requirements.Name: CP-2(e)
Requirements.Description: Update the contingency plan to address changes to the organization, system, or environment of operation and problems encountered during contingency plan implementation, execution, or testing.

Requirements.Name: CP-2(5) Continue Mission And Business Functions
Requirements.Description: Plan for the continuance of [Selection: all; essential] mission and business functions with minimal or no loss of operational continuity and sustains that continuity until full system restoration at primary processing and/or storage sites.

Requirements.Name: CP-2(6) Alternate Processing And Storage Sites
Requirements.Description: Plan for the transfer of [Selection: all; essential] mission and business functions to alternate processing and/or storage sites with minimal or no loss of operational continuity and sustain that continuity through system restoration to primary processing and/or storage sites.

Requirements.Name: CP-6(a)
Requirements.Description: Establish an alternate storage site, including necessary agreements to permit the storage and retrieval of system backup information.

Requirements.Name: CP-6(1) Separation From Primary Site
Requirements.Description: Identify an alternate storage site that is sufficiently separated from the primary storage site to reduce susceptibility to the same threats.

Requirements.Name: CP-6(2) Recovery Time And Recovery Point Objectives
Requirements.Description: Configure the alternate storage site to facilitate recovery operations in accordance with recovery time and recovery point objectives.

Requirements.Name: CP-9(a)
Requirements.Description: Conduct backups of user-level information contained in [Assignment: organization-defined system components] [Assignment: organization-defined frequency consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives].

Requirements.Name: CP-9(b)
Requirements.Description: Conduct backups of system-level information contained in the system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives].

Requirements.Name: CP-9(c)
Requirements.Description: Conduct backups of system documentation, including security- and privacy-related documentation [Assignment: organization-defined frequency consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives].

Requirements.Name: CP-9(d)
Requirements.Description: Protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of backup information.

Requirements.Name: CP-9(8) Cryptographic Protection
Requirements.Description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of [Assignment: organization-defined backup information].

Requirements.Name: System Recovery And Reconstitution (CP-10)
Requirements.Description: Provide for the recovery and reconstitution of the system to a known state within [Assignment: organization-defined time period consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives] after a disruption, compromise, or failure.

Requirements.Name: CP-10(2) Transaction Recovery
Requirements.Description: Implement transaction recovery for systems that are transaction-based.

Requirements.Name: Identification and Authentication (Organizational users) (IA-2)
Requirements.Description: The information system uniquely identifies and authenticates organizational users (or processes acting on behalf of organizational users).

Requirements.Name: IA-2(1) Multi-Factor Authentication To Privileged Accounts
Requirements.Description: Implement multi-factor authentication for access to privileged accounts.

Requirements.Name: IA-2(2) Multi-Factor Authentication To Non-Privileged Accounts
Requirements.Description: Implement multi-factor authentication for access to non-privileged accounts.

Requirements.Name: IA-2(6) Acces To Accounts — Separate Device
Requirements.Description: Implement multi-factor authentication for [Selection (one or more): local; network; remote] access to [Selection (one or more): privileged accounts; non-privileged accounts] such that: (a) One of the factors is provided by a device separate from the system gaining access; and (b) The device meets [Assignment: organization-defined strength of mechanism requirements].

Requirements.Name: IA-2(6)(a)
Requirements.Description: Implement multi-factor authentication for [Selection (one or more): local; network; remote] access to [Selection (one or more): privileged accounts; non-privileged accounts] such that: (a) One of the factors is provided by a device separate from the system gaining access.

Attributes.SubGroup: IA-2(6) Acces To Accounts — Separate Device

Requirements.Name: IA-2(8) Access To Accounts — Replay Resistant
Requirements.Description: Implement replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for access to [Selection (one or more): privileged accounts; non-privileged accounts].

Requirements.Name: IA-3(3)(b)
Requirements.Description: Audit lease information when assigned to a device.

Requirements.Name: IA-4(b)
Requirements.Description: Manage system identifiers by: b. Selecting an identifier that identifies an individual, group, role, service, or device.

Requirements.Name: IA-4(d)
Requirements.Description: Manage system identifiers by: d. Preventing reuse of identifiers for [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

Requirements.Name: IA-4(4)
Requirements.Description: Manage individual identifiers by uniquely identifying each individual as [Assignment: organization-defined characteristic identifying individual status].

Requirements.Name: IA-4(8)
Requirements.Description: Generate pairwise pseudonymous identifiers.

Requirements.Name: Authenticator Management (IA-5)
Requirements.Description: Authenticate users and devices. Automate administrative control. Enforce restrictions. Protect against unauthorized use.

Requirements.Name: IA-5(b)
Requirements.Description: Manage system authenticators by: b. Establishing initial authenticator content for any authenticators issued by the organization.

Requirements.Name: IA-5(c)
Requirements.Description: Manage system authenticators by: c. Ensuring that authenticators have sufficient strength of mechanism for their intended use.

Requirements.Name: IA-5(d)
Requirements.Description: Manage system authenticators by: d. Establishing and implementing administrative procedures for initial authenticator distribution, for lost or compromised or damaged authenticators, and for revoking authenticators.

Requirements.Name: IA-5(f)
Requirements.Description: Manage system authenticators by: f. Changing or refreshing authenticators [Assignment: organization-defined time period by authenticator type] or when [Assignment: organization-defined events] occur.

Requirements.Name: IA-5(h)
Requirements.Description: Manage system authenticators by: h. Requiring individuals to take, and having devices implement, specific controls to protect authenticators.

Requirements.Name: IA-5(1)(c)
Requirements.Description: For password-based authentication: (c) Transmit passwords only over cryptographically-protected channels.

Requirements.Name: IA-5(1)(f)
Requirements.Description: For password-based authentication: (f) Allow user selection of long passwords and passphrases, including spaces and all printable characters.

Requirements.Name: IA-5(1)(g)
Requirements.Description: For password-based authentication: (g) Employ automated tools to assist the user in selecting strong password authenticators.

Requirements.Name: IA-5(1)(h)
Requirements.Description: For password-based authentication: (h) Enforce the following composition and complexity rules: [Assignment: organization-defined composition and complexity rules].

Requirements.Name: IA-5(1)(h)
Requirements.Description: For password-based authentication: (h) Enforce the following composition and complexity rules: [Assignment: organization-defined composition and complexity rules].

Requirements.Name: IA-5(8) Multiple System Accounts
Requirements.Description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined security controls] to manage the risk of compromise due to individuals having accounts on multiple systems.

Requirements.Name: IA-5(18)(a)
Requirements.Description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined password managers] to generate and manage passwords.

Requirements.Name: IA-5(18)(b)
Requirements.Description: Protect the passwords using [Assignment: organization-defined controls].

Requirements.Name: IA-8(2)(b)
Requirements.Description: Document and maintain a list of accepted external authenticators.

Requirements.Name: IR-4(a)
Requirements.Description: Implement an incident handling capability for incidents that is consistent with the incident response plan and includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.

Requirements.Name: MA-4(c)
Requirements.Description: Employ strong authentication in the establishment of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions.

Requirements.Name: MA-4(1)(a)
Requirements.Description: Log [Assignment: organization-defined audit events] for nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions.

Requirements.Name: Media Access (MP-2)
Requirements.Description: Restrict access to [Assignment: organization-defined types of digital and/or non-digital media] to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles].

Requirements.Name: PE-6(2) Monitoring Physical Access
Requirements.Description: Recognize [Assignment: organization-defined classes or types of intrusions] and initiate [Assignment: organization-defined response actions] using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

Requirements.Name: PE-6(4) Monitoring Physical Access
Requirements.Description: Monitor physical access to the system in addition to the physical access monitoring of the facility at [Assignment: organization-defined physical spaces containing one or more components of the system].

Requirements.Name: PM-11(b)
Requirements.Description: Determine information protection and personally identifiable information processing needs arising from the defined mission and business processes.

Requirements.Name: PM-14(a)(1)
Requirements.Description: a. Implement a process for ensuring that organizational plans for conducting security and privacy testing, training, and monitoring activities associated with organizational systems: 1. Are developed and maintained.

Requirements.Name: PM-14(b)
Requirements.Description: Review testing, training, and monitoring plans for consistency with the organizational risk management strategy and organization-wide priorities for risk response actions.

Requirements.Name: Threat Awareness Program (PM-16)
Requirements.Description: Implement a threat awareness program that includes a cross-organization information-sharing capability for threat intelligence.

Requirements.Name: PM-17(b)
Requirements.Description: Review and update the policy and procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

Attributes.SubSection: Protecting Controlled Unclassified Information On External Systems (PM-17)

Requirements.Name: PM-21(b)
Requirements.Description: Retain the accounting of disclosures for the length of the time the personally identifiable information is maintained or five years after the disclosure is made, whichever is longer.

Requirements.Name: Continuous Monitoring Strategy (PM-31)
Requirements.Description: Develop an organization-wide continuous monitoring strategy and implement continuous monitoring programs that include: a. Establishing the following organization-wide metrics to be monitored: [Assignment: organization-defined metrics]; b. Establishing [Assignment: organization-defined frequencies] for monitoring and [Assignment: organization-defined frequencies] for assessment of control effectiveness; c. Ongoing monitoring of organizationally-defined metrics in accordance with the continuous monitoring strategy; d. Correlation and analysis of information generated by control assessments and monitoring; e. Response actions to address results of the analysis of control assessment and monitoring information; and f. Reporting the security and privacy status of organizational systems to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

Requirements.Name: RA-1(a)
Requirements.Description: Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 1. Search for indicators of compromise in organizational systems; and 2. Detect, track, and disrupt threats that evade existing controls.

Requirements.Name: RA-1(a)(1)
Requirements.Description: Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 1. Search for indicators of compromise in organizational systems.

Requirements.Name: RA-1(a)(2)
Requirements.Description: a. Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 2. Detect, track, and disrupt threats that evade existing controls.

Requirements.Name: RA-3(4) Predictive Cyber Analytics
Requirements.Description: Employ the following advanced automation and analytics capabilities to predict and identify risks to [Assignment: organization-defined systems or system components]: [Assignment: organization-defined advanced automation and analytics capabilities].

Requirements.Name: RA-3(a)(1)
Requirements.Description: a. Conduct a risk assessment, including: 1. Identifying threats to and vulnerabilities in the system.

Requirements.Name: RA-5(a)
Requirements.Description: Monitor and scan for vulnerabilities in the system and hosted applications [Assignment: organization-defined frequency and/or randomly in accordance with organization-defined process] and when new vulnerabilities potentially affecting the system are identified and reported.

Requirements.Name: RA-5(4) Discoverable Information
Requirements.Description: Determine information about the system that is discoverable and take [Assignment: organization-defined corrective actions].

Requirements.Name: RA-10(a)
Requirements.Description: Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 1. Search for indicators of compromise in organizational systems; and 2. Detect, track, and disrupt threats that evade existings.

Requirements.Name: RA-10(a)(1)
Requirements.Description: Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 1. Search for indicators of compromise in organizational systems; and 2. Detect, track, and disrupt threats that evade existings.

Requirements.Name: RA-10(a)(2)
Requirements.Description: a. Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 2. Detect, track, and disrupt threats that evade existings.

Requirements.Name: SA-1(1)
Requirements.Description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to enable integrity verification of software and firmware components.

Requirements.Name: SA-9(6) Organization-Controlled Cryptographic Keys
Requirements.Description: Maintain exclusive control of cryptographic keys for encrypted material stored or transmitted through an external system.

Requirements.Name: SA-10(1) Software And Firmware Integrity Verification
Requirements.Description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to enable integrity verification of software and firmware components.

Requirements.Name: SA-15(a)(4)
Requirements.Description: a. Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to follow a documented development process that: 4. Documents, manages, and ensures the integrity of changes to the process and/or tools used in development.

Requirements.Name: SC-5(1) Restrict Ability TO Attack Other Systems
Requirements.Description: Restrict the ability of individuals to launch the following denial-of-service attacks against other systems: [Assignment: organization-defined denial-of-service attacks].

Requirements.Name: SC-5(2) Capacity, Bandwidth, And Redundancy
Requirements.Description: Manage capacity, bandwidth, or other redundancy to limit the effects of information flooding denial-of-service attacks.

Requirements.Name: SC-5(3)(a)
Requirements.Description: Employ the following monitoring tools to detect indicators of denial-of-service attacks against, or launched from, the system: [Assignment: organization-defined monitoring tools].

Requirements.Name: SC-5(3)(b)
Requirements.Description: Monitor the following system resources to determine if sufficient resources exist to prevent effective denial-of-service attacks: [Assignment: organization-defined system resources].

Requirements.Name: SC-5(a)
Requirements.Description: [Selection: Protect against; Limit] the effects of the following types of denial-of-service events: [Assignment: organization-defined types of denial-of-service events].

Requirements.Name: SC-5(b)
Requirements.Description: Employ the following controls to achieve the denial-of-service objective: [Assignment: organization-defined controls by type of denial-of-service event].

Requirements.Name: Resource Availability (SC-6)
Requirements.Description: Protect the availability of resources by allocating [Assignment: organization-defined resources] by [Selection (one or more): priority; quota; [Assignment: organization-defined controls]].

Requirements.Name: SC-7(2) Public Access
Requirements.Description: Provide the capability to dynamically isolate [Assignment: organization-defined system components] from other system components.

Requirements.Name: SC-7(3) Access Points
Requirements.Description: Limit the number of external network connections to the system.

Requirements.Name: SC-7(4)(b)
Requirements.Description: Establish a traffic flow policy for each managed interface.

Requirements.Name: SC-7(4)(g)
Requirements.Description: Publish information to enable remote networks to detect unauthorized control plane traffic from internal networks.

Requirements.Name: SC-7(5) Deny By Default — Allow By Exception
Requirements.Description: Deny network communications traffic by default and allow network communications traffic by exception [Selection (one or more): at managed interfaces; for [Assignment: organization-defined systems]].

Requirements.Name: SC-7(7) Split Tunneling For Remote Devices
Requirements.Description: Prevent split tunneling for remote devices connecting to organizational systems unless the split tunnel is securely provisioned using [Assignment: organization-defined safeguards].

Requirements.Name: SC-7(9)(a)
Requirements.Description: Detect and deny outgoing communications traffic posing a threat to external systems.

Attributes.SubGroup: SC-7(9) Restrict Threatening Outgoing Communications Traffic

Requirements.Name: SC-7(9)(b)
Requirements.Description: Audit the identity of internal users associated with denied communications.

Attributes.SubGroup: SC-7(9) Restrict Threatening Outgoing Communications Traffic

Requirements.Name: SC-7(11) Restrict Incoming communications Traffic
Requirements.Description: Only allow incoming communications from [Assignment: organization-defined authorized sources] to be routed to [Assignment: organization-defined authorized destinations].

Requirements.Name: SC-7(12) Host-Based Protection
Requirements.Description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined host-based boundary protection mechanisms] at [Assignment: organization-defined system components].

Requirements.Name: SC-7(16) Prevent Discovery Of System Components
Requirements.Description: Prevent the discovery of specific system components that represent a managed interface.

Requirements.Name: SC-7(20) Prevent Discovery Of System Components
Requirements.Description: Prevent the discovery of specific system components that represent a managed interface.

Requirements.Name: SC-7(21) Isolation Of System Components
Requirements.Description: Employ boundary protection mechanisms to isolate [Assignment: organization-defined system components] supporting [Assignment: organization-defined missions and/or business functions].

Requirements.Name: SC-7(24)(b)
Requirements.Description: For systems that process personally identifiable information: (b) Monitor for permitted processing at the external interfaces to the system and at key internal boundaries within the system.

Requirements.Name: SC-7(25) Unclassified National Security System Connections
Requirements.Description: Prohibit the direct connection of [Assignment: organization-defined unclassified national security system] to an external network without the use of [Assignment: organization-defined boundary protection device].

Requirements.Name: SC-7(26) Classified National Security System Connections
Requirements.Description: Prohibit the direct connection of a classified national security system to an external network without the use of [Assignment: organization-defined boundary protection device].

Requirements.Name: SC-7(27) Unclassified Non-National Security System Connections
Requirements.Description: Prohibit the direct connection of [Assignment: organization-defined unclassified non-national security system] to an external network without the use of [Assignment: organization-defined boundary protection device].

Requirements.Name: SC-7(28) Connections To Public Networks
Requirements.Description: Prohibit the direct connection of [Assignment: organization-defined system] to a public network.

Requirements.Name: SC-7(a)
Requirements.Description: Monitor and control communications at the external managed interfaces to the system and at key internal managed interfaces within the system.

Requirements.Name: SC-7(b)
Requirements.Description: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are [Selection: physically; logically] separated from internal organizational networks.

Requirements.Name: SC-7(c)
Requirements.Description: Connect to external networks or systems only through managed interfaces consisting of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security and privacy architecture.

Requirements.Name: Transmission Confidentiality And Integrity (SC-8)
Requirements.Description: Protect the [Selection (one or more): confidentiality; integrity] of transmitted information.

Requirements.Name: SC-8(1) Cryptographic Protection
Requirements.Description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to [Selection (one or more): prevent unauthorized disclosure of information; detect changes to information] during transmission.

Requirements.Name: SC-8(2) Pre- And Post-Transmission Handling
Requirements.Description: Maintain the [Selection (one or more): confidentiality; integrity] of information during preparation for transmission and during reception.

Requirements.Name: SC-8(3) Cryptographic Protection For Message Externals
Requirements.Description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect message externals unless otherwise protected by [Assignment: organization-defined alternative physical controls].

Requirements.Name: SC-8(4) Conceal Or Ramdomize Communications
Requirements.Description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to conceal or randomize communication patterns unless otherwise protected by [Assignment: organization-defined alternative physical controls].

Requirements.Name: SC-8(5) Protected Distribution System
Requirements.Description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined protected distribution system] to [Selection (one or more): prevent unauthorized disclosure of information; detect changes to information] during transmission.

Requirements.Name: Cryptographic Key Establishment And Management (SC-12)
Requirements.Description: Establish and manage cryptographic keys when cryptography is employed within the system in accordance with the following key management requirements: [Assignment: organization-defined requirements for key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction].

Requirements.Name: SC-12(2) Symmetric Keys
Requirements.Description: Produce, control, and distribute symmetric cryptographic keys using [Selection: NIST FIPS-validated; NSA-approved] key management technology and processes.

Requirements.Name: SC-12(6) Physical Control Of Keys
Requirements.Description: Maintain physical control of cryptographic keys when stored information is encrypted by external service providers.

Requirements.Name: SC-13(a)
Requirements.Description: Determine the [Assignment: organization-defined cryptographic uses].

Requirements.Name: SC-16(1) Integrity Verification
Requirements.Description: Verify the integrity of transmitted security and privacy attributes.

Attributes.SubSection: Transmission Of Security And Privacy Attributes (SC-16)

Requirements.Name: Architecture And Provisioning For Name/Address Resolution Service (SC-22)
Requirements.Description: Ensure the systems that collectively provide name/address resolution service for an organization are fault-tolerant and implement internal and external role separation.

Requirements.Name: Session Authenticity (SC-23)
Requirements.Description: Protect the authenticity of communications sessions.

Requirements.Name: SC-23(3) Unique System-Generated Session Identifiers
Requirements.Description: Generate a unique session identifier for each session with [Assignment: organization-defined randomness requirements] and recognize only session identifiers that are system-generated.

Requirements.Name: SC-23(5) Allowed Certificate Authorities
Requirements.Description: Only allow the use of [Assignment: organization-defined certificate authorities] for verification of the establishment of protected sessions.

Requirements.Name: Thin Nodes (SC-25)
Requirements.Description: Employ minimal functionality and information storage on the following system components: [Assignment: organization-defined system components].

Requirements.Name: SC-28(1) Cryptographic Protection
Requirements.Description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of the following information at rest on [Assignment: organization-defined system components or media]: [Assignment: organization-defined information].

Requirements.Name: SC-28(2) Offline Storage
Requirements.Description: Remove the following information from online storage and store offline in a secure location: [Assignment: organization-defined information].

Requirements.Name: Distributed Processing And Storage (SC-36)
Requirements.Description: Distribute the following processing and storage components across multiple [Selection: physical locations; logical domains]: [Assignment: organization-defined processing and storage components].

Requirements.Name: SC-36(1)(a)
Requirements.Description: Employ polling techniques to identify potential faults, errors, or compromises to the following processing and storage components: [Assignment: organization-defined distributed processing and storage components].

Requirements.Name: SC-43(b)
Requirements.Description: Authorize, monitor, and control the use of such components within the system.

Requirements.Name: SI-1(a)(2)
Requirements.Description: a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]: 2. Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the system and information integrity policy and the associated system and information integrity controls;.

Requirements.Name: SI-1(1)(c)
Requirements.Description: Audit the use of the manual override capability.

Requirements.Name: SI-2(5) Automatic Software And Firmware Updated
Requirements.Description: Install [Assignment: organization-defined security-relevant software and firmware updates] automatically to [Assignment: organization-defined system components].

Requirements.Name: SI-2(2) Automated Flaw Remediation Status
Requirements.Description: Determine if system components have applicable security-relevant software and firmware updates installed using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms] [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

Requirements.Name: SI-2(a)
Requirements.Description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws.

Requirements.Name: SI-2(c)
Requirements.Description: Install security-relevant software and firmware updates within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] of the release of the updates.

Requirements.Name: SI-2(d)
Requirements.Description: Incorporate flaw remediation into the organizational configuration management process.

Requirements.Name: SI-3(c)(2)
Requirements.Description: c. Configure malicious code protection mechanisms to: 2. [Selection (one or more): block malicious code; quarantine malicious code; take [Assignment: organization-defined action]]; and send alert to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] in response to malicious code detection.

Requirements.Name: SI-3(8)(a)
Requirements.Description: Detect the following unauthorized operating system commands through the kernel application programming interface on [Assignment: organization-defined system hardware components]: [Assignment: organization-defined unauthorized operating system commands].

Requirements.Name: SI-3(8)(b)
Requirements.Description: [Selection (one or more): issue a warning; audit the command execution; prevent the execution of the command].

Requirements.Name: SI-4(a)
Requirements.Description: Monitor the system to detect: 1. Attacks and indicators of potential attacks in accordance with the following monitoring objectives: [Assignment: organization-defined monitoring objectives]; and 2. Unauthorized local, network, and remote connections.

Requirements.Name: SI-4(a)(1)
Requirements.Description: a. Monitor the system to detect: 1. Attacks and indicators of potential attacks in accordance with the following monitoring objectives: [Assignment: organization-defined monitoring objectives]; and 2. Unauthorized local, network, and remote connections.

Requirements.Name: SI-4(a)(2)
Requirements.Description: a. Monitor the system to detect: 2. Unauthorized local, network, and remote connections.

Requirements.Name: SI-4(b)
Requirements.Description: Identify unauthorized use of the system through the following techniques and methods: [Assignment: organization-defined techniques and methods].

Requirements.Name: SI-4(c)
Requirements.Description: c. Invoke internal monitoring capabilities or deploy monitoring devices: 1. Strategically within the system to collect organization-determined essential information; and 2. At ad hoc locations within the system to track specific types of transactions of interest to the organization.

Requirements.Name: SI-4(d)
Requirements.Description: Analyze detected events and anomalies.

Requirements.Name: SI-4(1) System-Wide Intrusion Detection System
Requirements.Description: Connect and configure individual intrusion detection tools into a system-wide intrusion detection system.

Requirements.Name: SI-4(2) Automated Tools For Real-Time Analysis
Requirements.Description: Implement the following additional monitoring of privileged users: [Assignment: organization-defined additional monitoring]. Employ automated tools and mechanisms to support near real-time analysis of events.

Requirements.Name: SI-4(3) Automated Tools And Mechanism Integration
Requirements.Description: Employ automated tools and mechanisms to integrate intrusion detection tools and mechanisms into access control and flow control mechanisms.

Requirements.Name: SI-4(4)(a)
Requirements.Description: Determine criteria for unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions for inbound and outbound communications traffic.

Attributes.SubGroup: SI-4(4) Inbound and Outbound Communications Traffic

Requirements.Name: SI-4(4)(b)
Requirements.Description: Monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] for [Assignment: organization-defined unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions].

Attributes.SubGroup: SI-4(4) Inbound and Outbound Communications Traffic

Requirements.Name: SI-4(10) Visibility Of Encrypted Communications
Requirements.Description: Make provisions so that [Assignment: organization-defined encrypted communications traffic] is visible to [Assignment: organization-defined system monitoring tools and mechanisms].

Requirements.Name: SI-4(12) Automated Organization-Generated Alerts
Requirements.Description: Alert [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms] when the following indications of inappropriate or unusual activities with security or privacy implications occur: [Assignment: organization-defined activities that trigger alerts].

Requirements.Name: SI-4(13)(a)
Requirements.Description: Analyze communications traffic and event patterns for the system.

Attributes.SubGroup: SI-4(13) Analyze Traffic And Event Patterns

Requirements.Name: SI-4(14) Wireless Intrusion Detection
Requirements.Description: Employ a wireless intrusion detection system to identify rogue wireless devices and to detect attack attempts and potential compromises or breaches to the system.

Requirements.Name: SI-4(17) Integrated Situational Awareness
Requirements.Description: Correlate information from monitoring physical, cyber, and supply chain activities to achieve integrated, organization-wide situational awareness.

Requirements.Name: SI-4(20) Privileged Users
Requirements.Description: Implement the following additional monitoring of privileged users: [Assignment: organization-defined additional monitoring].

Requirements.Name: SI-4(23) Host-Based Devices
Requirements.Description: Implement the following host-based monitoring mechanisms at [Assignment: organization-defined system components]: [Assignment: organization-defined host-based monitoring mechanisms].

Requirements.Name: SI-4(25) Optimize Network Traffic Analysis
Requirements.Description: Provide visibility into network traffic at external and key internal system interfaces to optimize the effectiveness of monitoring devices.

Requirements.Name: SI-5(1) Automated Alerts And Advisories
Requirements.Description: Broadcast security alert and advisory information throughout the organization using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

Requirements.Name: SI-5(b)
Requirements.Description: Generate internal security alerts, advisories, and directives as deemed necessary.

Requirements.Name: SI-7(1) Integrity Checks
Requirements.Description: Perform an integrity check of [Assignment: organization-defined software, firmware, and information] [Selection (one or more): at startup; at [Assignment: organization-defined transitional states or security-relevant events]; [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]].

Requirements.Name: SI-7(3) Centrally Managed Integrity Tools
Requirements.Description: Employ centrally managed integrity verification tools.

Requirements.Name: SI-7(7) Integration Of Detection And Response
Requirements.Description: Incorporate the detection of the following unauthorized changes into the organizational incident response capability: [Assignment: organization-defined security-relevant changes to the system].

Requirements.Name: SI-7(8) Auditing Capability For Significant Events
Requirements.Description: Upon detection of a potential integrity violation, provide the capability to audit the event and initiate the following actions: [Selection (one or more): generate an audit record; alert current user; alert [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]; [Assignment: organization-defined other actions]].

Requirements.Name: SI-7(a)
Requirements.Description: Employ integrity verification tools to detect unauthorized changes to the following software, firmware, and information: [Assignment: organization-defined software, firmware, and information].

Requirements.Name: SI-10(1)(c)
Requirements.Description: Audit the use of the manual override capability.

Requirements.Name: Information Management and Retention (SI-12)
Requirements.Description: Manage and retain information within the system and information output from the system in accordance with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, guidelines and operational requirements.

Requirements.Name: SI-13(5) Failover Capability
Requirements.Description: Provide [Selection: real-time; near real-time] [Assignment: organization-defined failover capability] for the system.

Requirements.Name: SI-19(4) Removal, Masking, Encryption, Hashing, Or Replacement Of Direct Identifiers
Requirements.Description: Remove, mask, encrypt, hash, or replace direct identifiers in a dataset.
